tool.name: read_file
tool.description: Read the contents of a file from the filesystem. Use this tool when you need to examine existing files, review code, read configuration files, or access any text-based file content.
tool.details: This tool reads the entire contents of a text file and returns it as a string. Important notes: - The file must exist and be readable - Binary files cannot be read with this tool - Large files will return their full content - Use relative or absolute file paths

parameter.name: file_path
parameter.description: Path to the file to read. Can be relative to current working directory or absolute path.

returns.description: Response containing: - success: Whether the file was read successfully - message: Status message with file size info or error details - data: The complete file contents as a string (or None on error)

tool.examples:
# Read a configuration file
config/settings.json
# Read a Python source file
/home/user/project/main.py
# Read a log file
logs/app.log
